originalText.text: Mailbox was full 2nd day straight January 9, 2024. Will be back to check tomorrow. Still no response. New York City still must be in permanent Covid 19 non work mode. They finally answered the phone. Feb. 5th 2023.

text.text: Mailbox was full 2nd day straight January 9, 2024. Will be back to check tomorrow. Still no response. New York City still must be in permanent Covid 19 non work mode. They finally answered the phone. Feb. 5th 2023.

originalText.text:
What a waste of my vote.

I’ve had chronic health issues for 3 years and have been trying to sell my co-op unit, purchased 3 months before I got sick, for 2 years now. My co-op’s board has rejected multiple prospective buyers for reasons I believe to be discriminatory, noting that it has approved every other sale in the 123-unit building over the past decade. After 2 years of being disallowed to sell my unit, I can no longer afford to continue paying for my own healthcare expenses. I am almost completely homebound due to my illness, making the process of selling my unit harder and harder with each passing day. I wake up each day thinking I’m going to die here because I can’t get my equity out in order to pay for medical treatment. While Jumaane Williams openly supports legislation regarding co-op board transparency for rejections, I couldn’t even get so much as an acknowledgement from this office. You got my vote but can’t even return my phone call when my life may depend on it? Shame on you.

UPDATE (7/7/2023): Still no response from his office, yet Jumaane Williams had time to personally antagonize me on Twitter for calling out the failure of his office to respond to or assist constituents.

What a waste of my vote.

I’ve had chronic health issues for 3 years and have been trying to sell my co-op unit, purchased 3 months before I got sick, for 2 years now. My co-op’s board has rejected multiple prospective buyers for reasons I believe to be discriminatory, noting that it has approved every other sale in the 123-unit building over the past decade. After 2 years of being disallowed to sell my unit, I can no longer afford to continue paying for my own healthcare expenses. I am almost completely homebound due to my illness, making the process of selling my unit harder and harder with each passing day. I wake up each day thinking I’m going to die here because I can’t get my equity out in order to pay for medical treatment. While Jumaane Williams openly supports legislation regarding co-op board transparency for rejections, I couldn’t even get so much as an acknowledgement from this office. You got my vote but can’t even return my phone call when my life may depend on it? Shame on you.

UPDATE (7/7/2023): Still no response from his office, yet Jumaane Williams had time to personally antagonize me on Twitter for calling out the failure of his office to respond to or assist constituents.

originalText.text: NYC has not had this great level of Politician since.. I don't know when because honestly that level of politician has never truly existed in NYC at was as very minuscule level where it did exist. But between Jumaane D. Williams and Letitia James, New York City is finally making attempts to restore the City back to a place where anyone from all walks of life can pursue their dreams without being held back on the basis of race, origin or creed.  Keep up the great work

originalText.text:
i would have given 'no stars' but the "post" button is greyed out until at least one star is selected....

Jumaane Williams openly supports and has declared himself to be "in solidarity with" a known terrorist. Why? Because he can't or won't be bothered to do five minutes worth of research. His kind of arrogant ignorance should NOT be tolerated in any person who holds a public office of such importance. Beliefs such as the ones espoused by Williams are not only dangerous, but offensive when one considers the fact that he holds a council position in New York City, a city already sensitive from the effects of terrorists and terrorism.

Williams supports Oscar Lopez Rivera, onetime FALN leader, who admitted - and was sentenced to prison for - bomb making and armed bank robbery, and who is known to have caused the death of five people in New York City. Williams claims that Rivera's violent, terrorist crimes were "the tools of a cause...used to fight for one's freedom" despite the fact (a fact of which Williams seems to be completely unaware) that Puerto Rico regularly holds referendums in which the general population votes to determine the future of their Island. The public choses whether Puerto Rico will exist as a state, a territory, or a free country, negating any claimed need to kill innocent Americans for "one's freedom" (aka; Rivera's wish to turn Puerto Rico into a communist state, and NOT any effort to create a "free country," despite any 'more publicly palatable spin' invented by Williams) and what's more,  they held these referendums even throughout the time of Rivera's terrorism in the U.S..

During his prison sentence, Rivera was offered clemency (by then-President Clinton) provided he be willing to denounce this violence. He refused to do so.

Jumaane Williams has had the nerve to compare THIS MONSTER to Martin Luther King and Nelson Mandela, and has spoken about the death of five innocent victims in  New York City, people murdered by Rivera, as if they were acceptable losses in some fantasy battle for independence on behalf of Puerto Rico, who;  by the way, has consistently voted to remain a U.S. commonwealth, thereby receiving benefits from our country without having to accept the responsibilities of statehood. I find it difficult to believe that Mr. Williams is oblivious to this information, but I prefer to believe that he is just lazy and uninformed to the alternative. The alternative being that Mr. Williams is well aware of the truth but willing to lie in order to get away with betraying his constituency and to get away with continuing to besmirch the office he holds.

Do not misunderstand: I DO believe in freedom of speech, and I agree that people have the right to believe whatever they wish to believe, no matter how disgusting or wrong it may be. However, things change when one takes office upon the trust of the people...You see, these beliefs are "fine" in some 'professional-victim' type, 'radical intellectual' who pickets "the man" for whichever 'flavor of the day' cause will allow him unfettered access to those "hot and bothered , daddy-issue, activist chicks" but these beliefs are not so "fine" in a man who has sworn to uphold the laws of the city of New York City and such statements/beliefs are absolutely, unapologetically obscene when held by a man who was voted into office based upon his promise to represent the people of that city. Mr. Jumaane Williams has removed his mask: now its time for the people who once supported him to get a good, long look at who they REALLY voted for.
